description: Retrieves a summary of an AWS Opportunity. This summary includes high-level details about the opportunity sourced from AWS, such as lifecycle information, customer details, and involvement type. It is useful for tracking updates on the AWS opportunity corresponding to an opportunity in the partner's account.

parameters.name: Catalog
parameters.description: Specifies the catalog in which the AWS Opportunity is located. Accepted values include AWS for production opportunities or Sandbox for testing purposes. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity data is pulled from.

parameters.name: RelatedOpportunityIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the related partner opportunity. Use this field to correlate an AWS opportunity with its corresponding partner opportunity.

nested_items.name: Catalog
nested_items.description: Specifies the catalog in which the AWS Opportunity exists. This is the environment (e.g., AWS or Sandbox) where the opportunity is being managed.

nested_items.name: Contacts
nested_items.description: Provides a list of customer contacts involved in the opportunity. These contacts may include decision makers, influencers, and other stakeholders within the customer's organization.

nested_items.name: BusinessTitle
nested_items.description: The partner contact's title (job title or role) associated with the Opportunity. BusinessTitle supports either PartnerAccountManager or OpportunityOwner.

nested_items.name: Email
nested_items.description: The contact's email address associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: FirstName
nested_items.description: The contact's first name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: LastName
nested_items.description: The contact's last name associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: Phone
nested_items.description: The contact's phone number associated with the Opportunity.

nested_items.name: EngagementScore
nested_items.description: Represents a score assigned by AWS to indicate the level of engagement and potential success for the opportunity. This score helps partners prioritize their efforts.

nested_items.name: NextBestActions
nested_items.description: Provides recommendations from AWS on the next best actions to take in order to move the opportunity forward and increase the likelihood of success.

nested_items.name: InvolvementType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of involvement AWS has in the opportunity, such as direct cosell or advisory support. This field helps partners understand the role AWS plays in advancing the opportunity.

nested_items.name: InvolvementTypeChangeReason
nested_items.description: Provides a reason for any changes in the involvement type of AWS in the opportunity. This field is used to track why the level of AWS engagement has changed from For Visibility Only to Co-sell offering transparency into the partnership dynamics.

nested_items.name: LifeCycle
nested_items.description: Contains lifecycle information for the AWS Opportunity, including review status, stage, and target close date. This field is crucial for partners to monitor the progression of the opportunity.

nested_items.name: ClosedLostReason
nested_items.description: Indicates the reason why an opportunity was marked as Closed Lost. This helps in understanding the context behind the lost opportunity and aids in refining future strategies.

nested_items.name: NextSteps
nested_items.description: Specifies the immediate next steps required to progress the opportunity. These steps are based on AWS guidance and the current stage of the opportunity.

nested_items.name: NextStepsHistory
nested_items.description: Provides a historical log of previous next steps that were taken to move the opportunity forward. This helps in tracking the decision-making process and identifying any delays or obstacles encountered.

nested_items.name: Time
nested_items.description: Indicates the date and time when a particular next step was recorded or planned. This helps in managing the timeline for the opportunity.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Represents the details of the next step recorded, such as follow-up actions or decisions made. This field helps in tracking progress and ensuring alignment with project goals.

nested_items.name: Stage
nested_items.description: Represents the current stage of the opportunity in its lifecycle, such as Qualification, Validation, or Closed Won. This helps in understanding the opportunity's progress.

nested_items.name: TargetCloseDate
nested_items.description: Indicates the expected date by which the opportunity is projected to close. This field helps in planning resources and timelines for both the partner and AWS.

nested_items.name: OpportunityTeam
nested_items.description: Details the AWS opportunity team, including members involved. This information helps partners know who from AWS is engaged and what their role is.

nested_items.name: BusinessTitle
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services team member's business title and indicates their organizational role.

nested_items.name: Email
nested_items.description: Provides the Amazon Web Services team member's email address.

nested_items.name: FirstName
nested_items.description: Provides the Amazon Web Services team member's first name.

nested_items.name: LastName
nested_items.description: Provides the Amazon Web Services team member's last name.

nested_items.name: Origin
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the AWS Opportunity originated from AWS or the partner. This helps distinguish between opportunities that were sourced by AWS and those referred by the partner.

nested_items.name: ExpectedCustomerSpend
nested_items.description: Indicates the expected spending by the customer over the course of the project. This value helps partners and AWS estimate the financial impact of the opportunity. Use the AWS Pricing Calculator to create an estimate of the customer's total spend. If only annual recurring revenue (ARR) is available, distribute it across 12 months to provide an average monthly value.

nested_items.name: Amount
nested_items.description: Represents the estimated monthly revenue that the partner expects to earn from the opportunity. This helps in forecasting financial returns.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: Indicates the currency in which the revenue estimate is provided. This helps in understanding the financial impact across different markets.

nested_items.name: EstimationUrl
nested_items.description: A URL providing additional information or context about the spend estimation.

nested_items.name: Frequency
nested_items.description: Indicates how frequently the customer is expected to spend the projected amount. This can include values such as Monthly, Quarterly, or Annually. The default value is Monthly, representing recurring monthly spend.

nested_items.name: TargetCompany
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the partner company that is expected to generate revenue from the opportunity. This field helps track the partner's involvement in the opportunity.

nested_items.name: RelatedEntityIds
nested_items.description: Lists related entity identifiers, such as AWS products or partner solutions, associated with the AWS Opportunity. These identifiers provide additional context and help partners understand which AWS services are involved.

nested_items.name: AwsProducts
nested_items.description: Specifies the AWS products associated with the opportunity. This field helps track the specific products that are part of the proposed solution.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Solutions
nested_items.description: Specifies the partner solutions related to the opportunity. These solutions represent the partner's offerings that are being positioned as part of the overall AWS opportunity.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RelatedOpportunityId
nested_items.description: Provides the unique identifier of the related partner opportunity, allowing partners to link the AWS Opportunity to their corresponding opportunity in their CRM system.

nested_items.name: Visibility
nested_items.description: Defines the visibility level for the AWS Opportunity. Use Full visibility for most cases, while Limited visibility is reserved for special programs or sensitive opportunities.
